channel.title: Blog.jetbrains.com on .NET Ramblings

item.title: Enhanced Vulnerable API Detection in JetBrains IDEs and Qodana
item.description: At the start of the year, we announced a partnership with Mend.io to maximize code security in JetBrains tools. The partnership provided us with quality data about vulnerable and malicious packages, allowing our IDEs and Qodana to spot them for you in your projects. Over the last few months, we have been working on integrating [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/idea/2025/09/enhanced-vulnerable-api-detection-in-jetbrains-ides-and-qodana/

item.title: The Most Popular Python Frameworks and Libraries in 2025
item.description: Whether you‚Äôre building APIs, dashboards, or machine learning pipelines, choosing the right framework can make or break your project. Every year, we survey thousands of Python developers to help you understand how the ecosystem is evolving, from tooling and languages to frameworks and libraries. Our insights from the State of Python 2025 offer a snapshot [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/pycharm/2025/09/the-most-popular-python-frameworks-and-libraries-in-2025/

item.title: dotInsights | September 2025
item.description: Did you know? The C# language has a GOTO statement? It sure does. This is a case of ‚Äújust because you could doesn‚Äôt mean you should‚Äù. Welcome to dotInsights by JetBrains! item.title: RubyMine Is Now Free for Non-Commercial Use
item.description: Hold on to your helper methods ‚Äì RubyMine is now FREE for non-commercial use! item.title: Meet Our Newest Innovators: Welcoming AI4SE Interns as JetBrains Employees!
item.description: Picture this: You‚Äôre working on your MSc thesis as an intern in software engineering, not just as an academic exercise, but side-by-side with an industry team, tackling real projects and real problems, refining code, and witnessing your ideas come alive. By the time you‚Äôve graduated, you‚Äôre already a valued team member, ready to hit the [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/research/2025/09/ai4se-interns-jetbrains-part-1/

item.title: The LSP API Is Now Available to All IntelliJ IDEA Users and Plugin Developers
item.description: The way developers create plugins implementing the Language Server Protocol (LSP) in JetBrains IDEs is undergoing a significant shift. With PyCharm and IntelliJ IDEA adopting a unified distribution model, we‚Äôre removing a key obstacle that has been limiting LSP adoption within the IntelliJ Platform ecosystem. Starting with IntelliJ IDEA Ultimate 2025.2, users can continue using [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/platform/2025/09/the-lsp-api-is-now-available-to-all-intellij-idea-users-and-plugin-developers/

item.title: ICPC World Finals Livestream: ecnerwala and SecondThread Speed-Solving Kotlin Challenge
item.description: Join us live from the ICPC World Finals in Baku, Azerbaijan, for a special event. This year, we are hosting a head-to-head match where two of the world‚Äôs top competitive programmers, Andrew ‚Äòecnerwala‚Äô He and David ‚ÄòSecondThread‚Äô Harmeyer, will speed-solve Kotlin problems in real time.¬†Save the date: September 2, 2025, at 9:30 am UTC [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/kotlin/2025/08/icpc-world-finals-livestream-ecnerwala-secondthread-kotlin/

item.title: Koog 0.4.0 Is Out: Observable, Predictable, and Deployable Anywhere You Build
item.description: Featuring Langfuse and W&B Weave Support, Ktor Integration, Native Structured Output, iOS Target, GPT-5, and More. Koog 0.3.0 was about making agents smarter and persistent. Koog 0.4.0 is about making them observable, seamlessly deployable in your stack, and more predictable in their outputs ‚Äì all while introducing support for new models and platforms. Read on [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/ai/2025/08/koog-0-4-0-is-out-observable-predictable-and-deployable-anywhere-you-build/

item.title: ReSharper‚Äôs New Out-of-Process Engine Cuts UI Freezes in Visual Studio by 80%
item.description: Visual Studio power users love ReSharper‚Äôs deep analysis, but the cost has been the occasional UI hiccup that breaks the flow of work. In ReSharper 2025.2, analysis runs in a separate 64-bit worker out of Visual Studio‚Äôs UI process. Previously, ReSharper shared Visual Studio‚Äôs UI process, so long analyses could stall the UI thread. Now, [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/dotnet/2025/08/28/resharper-s-new-out-of-process-engine-cuts-ui-freezes-in-visual-studio-by-80/

item.title: What‚Äôs Next for CLion: The 2025.3 Roadmap

item.title: Exploring Data Science With Kotlin: A Powerlifting Case Study
item.description: This is a guest post from Adele Carpenter. Adele is a Software Engineer and Consultant at Trifork Amsterdam, where she works on educational systems in the Kotlin/Java/Spring ecosystem and advises customers on their projects. TL;DR This blog post uses a dataset from the sport of powerlifting to get you up and running with Kotlin Notebooks, [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/kotlin/2025/08/exploring-data-science-with-kotlin-a-powerlifting-case-study/

item.title: Ready for the Best School Year Ever? Join Our STEM Clubs, Camps, and Competitions
